sentences.en: He always willing to enunciate his opinions on the subject of politics.
sentences.cn: 他总是愿意对政治问题发表意见.

sentences.en: He is always willing to enunciate his opinions on the subject of politics.
sentences.cn: 他总是愿意对政治问题发表意见.>enunciation/I9nQnsI5eIFn; I9nQnsI`eFEn/n[C,U].

sentences.en: He was ever ready to enunciate his views to all who would listen.
sentences.cn: 他总是乐意向所有愿意倾听的人阐明他的观点。

sentences.en: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentences.cn: 他用刺耳的声音小心地一字一句地念着。

sentences.en: ideas that he was to enunciate decades later
sentences.cn: 他将于数十年后清晰阐述的想法

sentences.en: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
Speak slowly, enunciate clearly, and show appropriate emotion and feeling related to your topic.
sentences.cn: 放缓你的语速, 咬词应清晰, 对相应的话题应注意有适当的感情表现.

sentences.en: To pronounce distinctly and carefully ; enunciate.
sentences.cn: 演员必须学会清晰地 发音.

trans.tran_cn: 清楚地念（字）；清晰地发（音），清楚地表明；阐明
trans.tran_en: to express an idea clearly and exactly
